Package com.example.trojanplanner.model

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.example.trojanplanner.model.Database
public class Database extends Object
A class that handles adding/querying/modifying/removing documents from the Firestore Database, as well as uploading/downloading/deleting images from the Firebase Storage.
Implemented as a singleton, so all classes that instantiate a Database get the same object. This allows adding listeners to ongoing queries instead of having to send new ones.

      public void initPhotoPicker()
      A method that initializes the PhotoPicker if you intend to use the uploadFromPhotoPicker method. THIS METHOD MUST BE CALLED IN THE ACTIVITY'S ONCREATE METHOD

    • deinitPhotoPicker

      public void deinitPhotoPicker()
      A method that uninitializes the PhotoPicker if initPhotoPicker was called. Should be called before switching activities

    • uploadFromPhotoPicker

      public void uploadFromPhotoPicker(User owner)
      Method that creates a PhotoPicker and uploads whatever image gets selected to the database. MUST first call initPhotoPicker to use this function.
      Parameters:
      owner - The user who will claim ownership of the uploaded image through their device ID

    • uploadImage

      public void uploadImage(@NonNull android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap, @NonNull User owner, String filepath, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Uploads an image to the Firebase Storage area tied to a given user. Sets the owner's pfpFilePath and pfpBitmap attributes when called.
      Parameters:
      bitmap - The bitmap of the image that should be uploaded
      owner - The user who will claim ownership of the uploaded image through their device ID
      filepath - The filepath to store the image as (USE CORRECT CONVENTIONS FOR THIS)
      successListener - The action that should be taken on a successful upload
      failureListener - The action that should be taken on a failed upload

    • uploadImage

      public void uploadImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap, User owner, String filepath)

    • uploadImage

      public void uploadImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap, User owner)
      Uploads an image to the Firebase Storage area tied to a given user. Sets the owner's pfpFilePath and pfpBitmap attributes when called. A wrapper function for the 5-parameter uploadImage designed for easier use. Uses our convention for image filepaths automatically. Sets a generic successlistener and failurelistener which should be suitable for most cases.
      Parameters:
      bitmap - The bitmap of the image that should be uploaded
      owner - The user who will claim ownership of the uploaded image through their device ID

    • downloadImage

      public void downloadImage(Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String filePath)
      Downloads a file from Firebase Storage with the given path. Executes the function defined in successListener on success and the function defined in failureListener on failure.
      To receive a bitmap of the downloaded image, you can initialize a Database.QuerySuccessAction and use the value given. Ex. 
       
 Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction = new Database.QuerySuccessAction() {
      @Override
      public void OnSuccess(Object object) {
          Bitmap bitmap = (Bitmap) object;
          imageView.setImageBitmap(bitmap);
          System.out.println("success!!");
      }
 };
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful download
      failureAction - The action to take on failed download
      filePath - The Firebase Storage path to download the image from

    • insertUserDocument

      public void insertUserDocument(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener, User user)
      Inserts a document into the users collection of the Firestore Database. Overwrites the previous document if one with the same device ID exists.
      Can optionally be given a custom success and failure listener to perform a more specialized action on success or failure.
      Parameters:
      successListener - The action to take on successful user insert
      failureListener - The action to take on failed user insert
      user - The user to insert into the database

      Parameters:

      Parameters:
      successListener - The action to take on successful user insert
      failureListener - The action to take on failed user insert
      QRHash - the hash data of the QR code to store
      event - the event object that the QR hash points to

    • getEvent

      public void getEvent(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String eventId)
      Gets an event document from the Firestore Database if the given eventId exists. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the event object can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful event query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed event query
      eventId - The event ID of the event desired to be received

    • getEntrant

      public void getEntrant(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String androidId)
      Gets an entrant document from the Firestore Database if the given androidId exists. Note that admins and organizers are allowed to be queried as entrants because they also have entrant abilities. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the entrant object can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful entrant query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed entrant query
      androidId - The android ID of the entrant desired to be received

    • getOrganizer

      public void getOrganizer(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String androidId)
      Gets an organizer document from the Firestore Database if the given androidId exists. Note that admins could be allowed to be queried as organizers if they also have organizer rights. If hasOrganizerRights is false on a valid document, the QueryFailureAction will be called since the requested document is not a valid organizer. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the organizer object can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful organizer query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed organizer query
      androidId - The android ID of the organizer desired to be received

    • getAdmin

      public void getAdmin(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String androidId)
      Gets an admin document from the Firestore Database if the given androidId exists. If hasAdminRights is false on a valid document, the QueryFailureAction will be called since the requested document is not a valid admin. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the admin object can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful admin query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed admin query
      androidId - The android ID of the admin desired to be received

    • getFacility

      public void getFacility(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String facilityId)
      Gets a facility document from the Firestore Database if the given facilityId exists. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the facility object can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful organizer query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed organizer query
      facilityId - The facility ID of the facility desired to be received

    • getQRData

      public void getQRData(@NonNull Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, @NonNull Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction, String QRHash)
      Gets the event ID from the Firestore Database associated with a given QR hash. This action is asynchronous and so the class calling this must initialize a QuerySuccessAction and QueryFailureAction and pass it into the function to determine what action should be taken when receiving the results. On a success, the eventId string can be received by downcasting the object parameter in the QuerySuccessAction.
      Parameters:
      successAction - The action to take on successful QR query
      failureAction - The action to take on failed QR query
      QRHash - The hash of the QR code desired to be received

    • createEmptyMap

      public void createEmptyMap(String eventId)
      Initializes and adds a document into Firebase for an empty map. This should be called at the same time the creation of a new event happens.
      Note: If there already an event at this location, THIS FUNCTION WILL OVERWRITE IT AND MAKE THE MAP EMPTY!
      Parameters:
      eventId -

    • insertLocation

      public void insertLocation(String eventID, String userID, double latitude, double longitude, Database.QuerySuccessAction successAction, Database.QueryFailureAction failureAction)

    • removeLocation

      public void removeLocation(String eventID, String userID)
      Removes the given user's location from a given event.
      Note: This works well unless you try to edit the same event map a lot at the same time. In this case race conditions may affect the resulting data.
      Parameters:
      eventID - The event to remove the user location from
      userID - The user whose location needs to be removed

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String eventId)
      Deletes the event with the given eventId. This will also delete the QR code for the event, the event map, and any references that any entrant or organizer had to that event.
      (No success or failure listeners given for this function, assume deletes will work successfully)
      Parameters:
      eventId - The event ID to fully delete from the database

    • deleteQRCode

      public void deleteQRCode(String eventId)
      Deletes (all) QR codes associated with a given event ID.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The event ID to delete any QR codes of

    • deleteMap

      public void deleteMap(String eventId)
      Deletes an event map associated with the given Event ID.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the map to delete (map ID == event ID)

    • deleteFacility

      public void deleteFacility(String facilityId)
      Deletes a facility from the database, INCLUDING ALL EVENTS AT THAT FACILITY! This method also turns the owner of the facility into a normal entrant.
      Parameters:
      facilityId - The facility ID to fully delete from the database

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String deviceId)
      Deletes the user entirely from the database, including any references as well:
      • If the user is only an entrant, simply delete their reference in any event lists and maps they were in
      • If the user is an organizer, delete the facility they owned (including all events at that facility), as well as the above entrant logic
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The ID of the user to delete along with all references

    • deleteImage

      public void deleteImage(String imagePath)
      Deletes an image from Firebase Storage, and also nulls all photo attributes that were using it.
      Parameters:
      imagePath - The path of the image to delete.
